body: It also looks like as if following requests fail with `already creating client for key`
Is there a way to reproduce this?

I haven't found one. But I didn't really try.

What I was doing was to quickly send telemetry requests during the startup of the protocol adapter.

We also just encountered this issue. It looks like it could have something to do with a previous connection error:
````
Caused by: io.netty.resolver.dns.DnsNameResolverTimeoutException: [/10.96.0.10:53] query timed out after 500 milliseconds (no stack trace available)
2019-06-14 08:18:59.218 [vert.x-eventloop-thread-1] DEBUG o.e.h.c.impl.ConnectionFactoryImpl - can't connect to AMQP 1.0 container [amqps://messaging-default.hono:5671]: Search domain query failed. Original hostname: 'messaging-default.hono' failed to resolve 'messaging-default.hono.hono.svc.cluster.local' after 2 queries
2019-06-14 08:18:59.218 [vert.x-eventloop-thread-1] DEBUG o.e.h.client.impl.HonoConnectionImpl - connection attempt failed
io.netty.resolver.dns.DnsResolveContext$SearchDomainUnknownHostException: Search domain query failed. Original hostname: 'messaging-default.hono' failed to resolve 'messaging-default.hono.hono.svc.cluster.local' after 2 queries
        at io.netty.resolver.dns.DnsResolveContext.finishResolve(DnsResolveContext.java:845)
````
Comparing the current code with the one from 0.9 (HonoClientImpl), one difference is that now there is no `checkConnected()` invocation preceding the receiver creation anymore.

@calohmn that might indeed be the problem. At least this would explain the behavior wrt the context that the problem occurred in for @ctron. Looks like the downstream connection(s) were not established yet when the devices started to send telemetry ...

Reproducible with the Lora protocol adapter: It tries to open command consumer links on startup. This is currently done in `AbstractVertxBasedHttpProtocolAdapter.onStartupSuccess`. But in that method, the `commandConsumerFactory` connection might not have been connected yet (see `AbstractProtocolAdapterBase.startInternal`).

I've added a `checkConnected()` invocation in `HonoConnectionImpl` when creating a sender/receiver. I've also fixed the LoraAdapter to create the consumers only after the connection has been made.
That should fix the NPE.

As a further improvement we could think about introducing some kind of retry mechanism here so that temporary disconnects lead to fewer errors.
As I didn't use the lora adapter, is that still fixed with the other adapters as well?
Yes, the extra `checkConnected()` check in `HonoConnectionImpl` prevents the NPE.

As an afterthought here:
We also saw this NPE causing all following receiver creation requests on the given address to fail with `already creating client for key` (in `CachingClientFactory#getOrCreateClient()`.

Since this `getOrCreateClient()` method is used in quite many places and since bugs like the above NPE could be hard to spot with all the `already creating client for key` messages cluttering the logs, I suggest we add exception handling here, see PR #1305.
